trans-unit.source: Contains the parameters that are used to create an <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> object using the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.#ctor(System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters)"></xref> constructor.
This structure is used only in the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> object constructor call.

The properties whose values are established by this structure are not directly exposed on <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> instances when an <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> is constructed.

However, the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> structure typically affect general [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] properties such as "Height" and "Width" that might exist in specific hosted objects and their [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)].
Do not construct instances of this structure using the default (parameterless) constructor.

An <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> instance that is created by the default constructor results in <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> that cannot be assigned a <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> (even though the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> property appears to be settable).
If such an instance is applied as the parameters for an <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> constructor, the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource>cannot display a window.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> class with a specified window name.
The window's name.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> class with a specified window name and initial size.
Do not pass 0 (zero) for either the `width` or `height` parameters.
Although the method eventually succeeds, even if you do pass 0, a significant performance penalty occurs.
The window's name.
The window's width, in pixels.
The window's height, in pixels.
Gets or sets the value that determines whether to acquire Win32 focus for the WPF containing window when an <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> is created.
`true` to acquire Win32 focus for the WPF containing window when the user interacts with menus; otherwise, `false`.
`null` to use the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.DefaultAcquireHwndFocusInMenuMode"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include the nonclient area for sizing.

The <xref:System.Windows.Window> class sets this parameter to `true` when using this structure internally, as part of its [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win32](~/includes/tlasharptla-win32-md.md)] window-creation process.
`true` if the layout manager sizing logic should include the nonclient area; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Determines whether this structure is equal to a specified object.
This implementation checks all members (public and private) of both structures for exact value equality.
The objects to be tested for equality.
`true` if the comparison is equal; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether this structure is equal to a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure.
This implementation checks all members (public and private) of both structures for exact value equality.
The structure to be tested for equality.
`true` if the structures are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the extended [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/includes/tlasharptla-win-md.md)] styles for the window.
The extended window styles.
See [CreateWindowEx](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=98462) for a list of these styles.
The default is 0 (no extended window styles).
Returns the hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> instance.
This implementation uses the Object implementation of GetHashCode.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Gets a value that indicates whether a size was assigned.
If a size was not assigned, the window has the default size.

Calls to <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.SetSize%2A> or setting <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Width%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Height%2A> all result in this property being `true`.
`true` if the window size was assigned; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`, unless the structure was created with provided height and width, in which case the value is `true`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the height of the window.

Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen-region measures in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)], you specify this window size in device pixels, not the typical device-independent units.
If you need to size your window to its content, set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.SizeToContent%2A> to `true`.
Do not set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Height%2A> to 0 (zero).
Doing so incurs a significant performance penalty in rendering.
The height of the window, in device pixels.
The default value is 1.
Gets or sets the message hook for the window.
This message hook is enabled before `CreateWindow` is called so that it receives all the window creation messages.
The message hook for the window.
Determines whether an <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure is equal to another <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure.
This implementation calls the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Equals%2A> method.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if the structures are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether an <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure is not equal to another <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure.
This implementation calls the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Equals%2A> method and inverts the result.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if the structures are not equal; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the window handle (HWND) of the parent for the created window.
The HWND of the parent window.
Gets or sets the left-edge position of the window.
The left-edge position of the window.
The default is CW_USEDEFAULT, as processed by CreateWindow.
Gets or sets the upper-edge position of the window.
The upper-edge position of the window.
The default is CW_USEDEFAULT, as processed by CreateWindow.
Gets or sets how WPF handles restoring focus to the window.
WPF automatically tries to restore focus to the window unless <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.RestoreFocusMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Input.RestoreFocusMode.None>.
One of the enumeration values that specifies how WPF handles restoring focus for the window.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Input.RestoreFocusMode.Auto"></xref>.
Sets the values that are used for the screen position of the window for the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref>.
The position of the left edge of the window.
The position of the upper edge of the window.
Sets the values that are used for the window size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref>.

Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen-region measures in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)], you specify this window size in device pixels, not in the typical device-independent units.
If you need to size your window to its content, set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.SizeToContent%2A> to `true`.
Do not pass 0 (zero) for either the `width` or `height` parameters.
Although the method eventually succeeds even if you do pass 0, a substantial performance penalty occurs.
The width of the window, in device pixels.
The height of the window, in device pixels.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the parent windows of the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> should be considered the non-client area of the window during layout passes.
`true` if parent windows of the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> should be considered the non-client area of the window during layout passes.; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> should receive window messages raised by the message pump via the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.ComponentDispatcher"></xref>.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> should receive window messages raised by the message pump via the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.ComponentDispatcher"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> corresponds to a top-level window; otherwise, the default is `false`.
Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel opacity of the source window content is respected.
By enabling per-pixel opacity, the system no longer draws the non-client area.

The opacity is used when the window is drawn on the desktop (it represents a final rendering step and does not appear as a contributor to property values such as <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Opacity%2A>).
<xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.UsesPerPixelOpacity%2A> applies only to top-level windows.
`true` if using per-pixel opacity; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that declares whether the per-pixel transparency of the source window content is respected.
`true` if using per-pixel transparency; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the width of the window.

Unlike most methods that take rectangle screen region measures in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)], you specify this window's size in device pixels, not in the usual device-independent units.
If you need to size your window to its content, set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.SizeToContent%2A> to `true`.
Do not set <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.Width%2A> to 0 (zero).
Doing so incurs a substantial performance penalty in rendering.
The window width, in device pixels.
The default value is 1.
Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/includes/tlasharptla-win-md.md)] class style for the window.
The window class style.
See [Window Class Styles](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=178417) for detailed information.
The default is 0 (no window class style).
Gets or sets the name of the window.
Do not construct instances of this structure using the default (parameterless) constructor.

An <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> instance that is created by the default constructor results in <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters> that cannot be assigned a <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> (even though the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSourceParameters.WindowName%2A> property appears to be settable).
If such an instance is applied as the parameters for an <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> constructor, the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource> cannot display a window.
The window name.
Gets or sets the style for the window.
By default, the following bits are set when the structure is created: WS_VISIBLE; WS_CAPTION; WS_SYSMENU; WS_THICKFRAME; WS_MINIMIZEBOX; WS_MAXIMIZEBOX; WS_CLIPCHILDREN.
For a standard window, you must set the WS_CLIPCHILDREN bit.
This style bit is enforced in the code itself; if you omit to set this flag, WPF adds it to whatever value you provide.
The window style.
See the [CreateWindowEx](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=98462) function for a complete list of style bits.
Defaults: WS_VISIBLE, WS_CAPTION, WS_SYSMENU, WS_THICKFRAME, WS_MINIMIZEBOX, WS_MAXIMIZEBOX, WS_CLIPCHILDREN
